dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Don't upset my Mom.     Don't you upset my Mom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael, calm down. Please. It's
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael, stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not my Mom. Not my silly silly Mom.

direction.raw_text: M ichael POUNDS on the bathroom door.     Letty dials 9-1-1.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael HOWLS -- a long, piercing inhuman sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other side of the door, Michael SCREAMS.    Another window SHATTERS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got an emergency.    I'm at...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: North Jenkins. Apartment 2. My boyfriend's out of control.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Please, please, send someone. (beat) No, he's having an attack. He's schizophrenic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Letty, wearing Michael's tux jacket, is curled up on the floor in a fetal position. She stares...at the upset flowers, at the ripped-up pillows, at a fist-sized hole ripped through an unsturdy wall. Her gaze stops on a Spaghetti-O's can, lying empty on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the door.   Letty rises slowly, padding to the door like an old woman. The KNOCKS grow urgent.   Letty opens the door to Ruth. Letty throws herself into Ruth's waiting embrace. Immediately, Letty cries. After a moment, Letty steps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruth looks into Letty's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruth pulls Letty into the apartment and shuts the door behind them. It is only then that she sees the destruction in the living room. Horror flashes across her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears stream down Letty's face.   Ruth starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty shakes her head "no." Her sobbing intensifies. Ruth puts her arm around Letty, and together, they sit on the floor. Ruth holds Letty until the crying eases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruth holds her close again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, so sorry.   I never should have called.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did the right thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ruined your wedding night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm glad you called. Now, not another word about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he hurt you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Ruthie, what am I going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to make any decisions tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what am I going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want to go see him? I'll take you if you want to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't.    I can't see him there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was so sure. I really thought it would work. (beat) We have plans, Ruth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.    I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Letty sits on the same bluff she once shared with Michael. She smokes a cigarette, and stares out at the ocean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty remains on the bluff, crying. A priest, passing in the background looks over at her, and continues on his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the darkness, Letty lies on her back. She stares up at the moon and stars, bright against the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty walks along a pathway with Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty reaches up to hug him.    He quickly disengages himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul starts down the path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty runs up to Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty hands Paul the engagement ring. He takes it and continues walking as she stares after him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm glad you agreed to see me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just glad there aren't any hard feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, none. None. I completely understand what was going on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's work going?    Are you back at school?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I start on Monday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So things are back on track?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Getting back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I heard about your friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I heard your friend was back in the hospital.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael.   Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just wondered, well, if this meant there was a chance for us. Because I think about you a lot, and I still feel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our relationship meant a lot to me, too, Paul. But it's over. (beat) And Michael being in the hospital doesn't really change things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I've heard this speech before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm really sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got a deposition that I really need to get cracking on, so if you don't mind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait. Wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to give you this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Letty walks up the steps to the imposing facility. We follow her journey through the VISITING ROOM, past families conversing with patients, to the NURSES' STATION. Letty walks up to Nurse Gates, who gives her a quick hug. John and Bill watch as Letty signs the visitors' register.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty walks down the HALLWAY and pauses outside Michael's door. She KNOCKS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's in Jamie's old room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Michael is in the middle of taping up the same Houdini poster we saw in his last room when Letty enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty and Michael kiss awkwardly.    Dead silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They smile nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty rolls her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty and Michael glare at each other.    Letty looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty waits. She looks away. She turns back and stares into Michael's eyes. Finally, she says it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty starts to cry.   Tears well up in Michael's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael sits down on the bed and they hold each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty and Michael grip each other.    Finally, they pull apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty wipes a tear from Michael's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T he couple kisses more tenderly than ever before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael puts his hand under Letty's chin and draws her head up so he can look into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty shakes her head "no" as tears stream down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty stands up and walks toward the door. She comes back and embraces Michael again. Slowly, they separate, and Letty leaves the room. Michael stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess we need to talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's hard to know where to start.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pretend like I'm your shrink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry.   I'll be quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think about you all the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I sure know what that feels like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And all the plans we have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, the plans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been thinking I could try to visit you at night after work, and then there'd be more time on weekends to see...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Letty, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I've told you before I don't want you taking care of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someone has to take care of you right now, Michael. You tore up the apartment. You stopped taking your medications.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But that wasn't me.    I didn't mean to do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well then why'd it happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I don't fucking know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry.     I didn't come here to blame you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't mean for any of this to happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, God, Michael, I know. (softly) Why does everything have to be so hard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are we going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know I don't want to lose you.     I don't think I could stand it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but can you stand to be with me like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I can't, Michael. I'm so sorry, but I just can't handle all this right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.   I can't either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you so much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you too, Letty.     I love you, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we could just run away to Tahiti and live on the beach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the best idea I've heard in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you have a magic trick or something to make this easier?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about something better?   Like a kiss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can still come visit you, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would that really be such a good idea for either of us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just promise me you'll be OK, OK?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will. And you make sure you take care of yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Promise you won't fall for any guys pretending to be doctors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess I should go now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Letty walks out the door, down the steps and along the front walkway -- until, finally, the hospital recedes in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty sits on top of a desk. Children of all ages stare her down. A few familiar faces--Bobby and Jenny--grace the room. Principal Gail passes outside the window and glances in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Letty trails off. She sees that she's lost the class. Bobby launches a spit wad that hits the boy in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks up to Bobby. He twists around in his seat, trying to hide the rest of his supply of spit wads. Letty waves her hand around Bobby's head. The children, stare, delighted. She pulls a bright coin out of his ear, and hands it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letty puts her hands behind her back and produces a bouquet of paper flowers. Now, she's got the class hooked.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: First of all, I want to welcome you to MathShop. I have lots of fun games planned for us. (beat) Let's see, Bobby, can you help me pass out these cards?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why were you gone so long?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My mom said you went crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had what some people call a nervous breakdown. I wasn't dealing with life so well so I went...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To a place for psychos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To a psychiatric institution.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a place where you figure out what you want, and what things in your life aren't working. You learn to look out for yourself and not get...
